unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Probability: Making Free Throws
question_text:
A professional basketball player has a $60$% chance of making his first throw. If he makes his first free throw, there is a $70$% chance he makes his second free throw. If he does not make his first throw, there is a $45$% chance he makes his second free throw. If this professional basketball player has made his second free throw, what is the probability he missed his first throw?
If this professional basketball player has made his second free throw, what is the probability he missed his first throw?
solution:
This type of a probability is a conditional probability, as we already know something has happened, meaning a condition has been satisfied.

The event that we know has happened is the player has made the second free throw. In this case, we are asked to find the probability the player misses the first free throw given he made the second free throw.
